lv.emes.libraries.tools.platform

Class MS_KeyStrokeExecutor

  • java.lang.Object
    • lv.emes.libraries.tools.platform.MS_KeyStrokeExecutor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IKeyStrokeExecutor

    public class MS_KeyStrokeExecutor
extends java.lang.Object
implements IKeyStrokeExecutor
    Recognizes, what OS is device using and creates corresponding object to imitate keyboard button pressing and mouse controlling.

    Public methods: -keyDown -keyUp -keyPress -isKeyDown -isCapsLockToggled -getCurrentMouseCoords -mouseLeftDown -mouseLeftUp -mouseLeftClick -mouseRightDown -mouseRightUp -mouseRightClick -mouseSetCoords -mouseMove

    Version:
    0.7.
    Author:
    eMeS

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MS_KeyStrokeExecutor()
      Constructs robot for executing keystrokes and simulating mouse events.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MS_KeyStrokeExecutor

        public MS_KeyStrokeExecutor()
                     throws java.awt.AWTException
        Constructs robot for executing keystrokes and simulating mouse events.
        Throws:
        java.awt.AWTException - if the platform configuration does not allow low-level input control. This exception is always thrown when GraphicsEnvironment.isHeadless() returns true.
